text: Is there an ability in the search api to return the number of results from a search, similar to how Google shows “About 224,000 results)?
I believe there is a total returned
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>
looks like "total" is the first item in the return results
You can always test a return like so <https://www.HubSpot.com/_hcms/search?term=test>
Well will you look at that.
Thanks for the info.
Is there an API for CTAs? I'm trying to grab a list of the CTA's and what pages they are on along with their stats
no not at this point, unfortunately  :slightly_frowning_face:

found this idea though: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/CTA-API-to-grab-existing-CTA-Name-amp-Embed-Code/idi-p/11554> if you wanna upvote / comment? I think its a pretty logical thing to add to our content APIs. Looks like it has over 100 votes which is a lot

GET /owners/v2/owners/
Question: Is there a way to get the last login date/time for an owner?
Is there any reason why we are not able to pass over a hutk over to a user via the contacts api?
when using the create / update api
I know you can do it via form submit api but not via contact create api
would /contacts/v1/search/query work? using the token?
nope, these contacts are being created via the api so technically they aren't in HubSpot yet

yeah contacts endpoint states: "Note: This endpoint is designed for offline contacts, and does not support lead tracking. If your contacts come through online forms, use the Form Submission endpoint."
thats what you want to happen right?

Correct, we have the tracking code on the customers site, but when the user get to a certain point, we are creating contacts via the api, so technically, they have a `hutk` as they are on the site already, we are just creating via api and not form submission
why dont you want to use as a form submission via ajax?

we can always switch to doing a form submission via api (and that is what we are looking at doing) so they can be tracked, but we were curious why thats also not a value to pass over in the normal contact api
:slightly_smiling_face:

I think the reason is that it just exists like that :man-shrugging: This endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form> or the ajax ones are the ones that will allow you to track user data
is there a way to use any of the apis to view that utk of a user?

i know you can use the "Get a contact by its user token
" api to find a contact by it, but can you do the reverse and find a users UTK?
you cannot - none of the endpoints will retrieve hutk data, but can you explain your use-case?

So we are doing an abandoned cart thing for a customer. A registered site user abandons the checkout and then we create a contact in their HubSpot portal via the api and that information is used in our AC workflows
we are trying to simply pass the `hutk` over to the contact while creating it (without having to do a form submission)
if we have to use the form submission, we can do that, its not a problem, we just figured it would be easier to push all that in a simple contact creation since we have the info.
Overall, with what we did create via the api,we weren't sure if HS assigns a utk to an email automatically when the contact is created

a little bit about how we assign usertokens: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/account/how-does-HubSpot-track-visitors>. you can’t pass the hutk to the contact since it gets set automatically in the browser by the tracking code. Forms API is pretty much the same functionality as the contacts API, just creates contacts via a form. A lot of the time people will use one main form that they’ve created to pass all their contacts via API through
but yeah i see your use case. Grab utk from the browser and push the contact to HubSpot via contacts api, but forms api is the way to do it mostly just because
Also you can create contacts using the `identify` method of the tracking code API: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/identify_visitor>
Full disclosure, I didn't read this thread in detail. Just wanted to mention this alternative
